metadata.title: CVE-2021-29264 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 5.11.10.drivers/net/ethernet/freescale/gianfar.c in the Freescale Gianfar Ethernetdriver allows attackers to cause a system crash because a negative fragmentsize is calculated in situations involving an rx queue overrun when jumbopackets are used and NAPI is enabled, aka CID-d8861bab48b6.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29264` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-143.147
linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-143.147
linux-image-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-143.147
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-143.147
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-143.147
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-74-generic - 5.4.0-74.83~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-74-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-74.83~18.04.1

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-143.147').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-74.83~18.04.1').
